file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 21-31-03-07 - ELECTROPNEUMATIC OUTFLOW VALVE - CLEANING/PAINTING

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL ELECTROPNEUMATIC OUTFLOW VALVE - CLEANING/PAINTING EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedure to clean the seat of the electropneumatic outflow valve. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ELECTROPNEUMATIC OUTFLOW VALVE ALL 21-31-03-100-801-A ♦ - CLEANING EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 21-31-03 Page 1 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 21-31-03-100-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. ELECTROPNEUMATIC OUTFLOW VALVE - CLEANING A. General (1) The cleaning will prevent the tacky mixture of collected dirty material with remaining tobacco in the valve seat. This could cause damage to the aircraft pressurization control. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 272 272DR Rear fuselage I D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Clean cloth free from lints To clean the valve 1 available F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) Fed. Spec. TT-I-735 Isopropyl alcohol AR Commercially available Solution of water and mild soap AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Inside the rear fuselage I I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Open access door 272DR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 100-801-A/700 21-31-03 Page 2 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Clean Electropneumatic Outflow Valve (Figure 701) SUBTASK 140-002-A (1) Manually move the poppet case from the outflow valve seat. (2) Moderately rub the outflow valve seat with a clean cloth soaked in isopropyl alcohol or a solution of water and mild soap. NOTE: If necessary, have a small wooden rod (a pencil less its point, for example) with a cloth around its end to help the cleaning. Do not use a knife or other cutting tool to remove the unwanted material from the outflow valve seat. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Close access door 272DR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 100-801-A/700 21-31-03 Page 3 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
